overview:
Bromley joined Mail Online / Associated Newspapers as MD in April 2008.

Mail Online is now the UK’s largest Newspaper website and is also the second largest english language newspaper site in the World. Bromley has been an advocate of mainstream content remaining free and has more recently seen MailOnline launch in America with offices in NYC & LA.

He previously worked for Trader Media Group (www.AutoTrader.co.uk), where he was Group Business Development Director, driving the implementation of a strategy to migrate the business online.

James sits on NLA, AOP, JICWEBS & BIMA boards.

Bromley started in online in 1996, as the second employee of the UK’s first online sales house NMMS. Following which, Foresight, a agency leading clients such as Disney, Interflora and American Express in their early online ventures.

In the late 90’s Bromley set up and ran a dance music radio station on the South Coast of England which was later sold to Guardian Media Group. www.fireradio.co.uk
